alert.note: Alert for Adams; Billings; Bowman; Burleigh; Emmons; Golden Valley; Grant; Hettinger; Kidder; Logan; McIntosh; Morton; Sioux; Slope; Stark (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued November 01 at 3:10PM CDT until November 02 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH FOR MUCH OF SOUTHWEST AND SOUTH CENTRAL NORTH DAKOTA WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING... .Critical fire weather conditions are possible across much of southwest and south central North Dakota on Wednesday. Afternoon temperatures are forecast to soar into the lower to mid 70s, with humidity falling as low as 15 percent. Winds will gradually shift from south to southwest throughout the day, with sustained speeds increasing to 20 mph and gusts as high as 35 mph. This may result in a few hours of critical fire weather conditions. A cold front arriving after sunset could prolong gusty winds and shift direction to the northwest. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR MUCH OF SOUTHWEST AND SOUTH CENTRAL NORTH DAKOTA... * WINDS...South to southwest 20 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 15 percent. * AFFECTED AREA...Much of southwest and south central North Dakota. * IMPACTS...Any fires that ignite will spread rapidly and become difficult to control or suppress.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Adams; Billings; Bowman; Burleigh; Emmons; Golden Valley; Grant; Hettinger; Kidder; Logan; McIntosh; Morton; Sioux; Slope; Stark
